CatDescriptText: Albert Everett, steel worker, 611-1/2 Amity Street, Homestead, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 21, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you favor an increase in state sales tax or a graduated income tax as a means of raising revenue for a commonwealth of Pennsylvania?" answer reads: "My preference is the sales tax. This way you will be paying right along rather than having to pay out a lump sum of money at one time."
TitMainTitle: Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper reporter George Barbour, writing in notebook, standing with Albert Everett wearing light colored trench coat and dark bow tie, in front of Bud Saunder's Flowers in Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
